column2: The Lord Protector's castle, situated with a view of the entire city.
The blood of a realm flows through its veins. Establish and protect the connections to make this possible.
Gold is the blood of a realm, and bloodletting improves its flow.
With better roads, the realm runs faster.
The flow of trade and men needs to be regulated for the safety of the people.
The best roads make men run with joy.
Man needs food to live, and the realm needs men to grow it.
The land provides, provided you provide the land what it needs. Water is the blood of life.
Improve the state of the land for it to improve its tribute to the realm.
There is only so much land in the realm, and the realm knows best who to hold it.
Effective distribution of land to the effective administrators of the realm is the key to the growth of the realm.
Man does not subsist on the green of the land alone.
Sometimes, the fruit of the land is best consumed through another life.
The horse is the best friend of any realm
The better the horse, the better the realm.
Only the best horses for the best realms.
Allow the establishment of a settlement close to your walls, offering them protection in exchange for taxation.
Build a granary that could store grain for use by men and merchants.
Grain does not feed one as well as bread does.
Trade is the life of any realm.
The best goods are the goods you didn't make yourself.
It is often necessary to go beyond the walls of the realm to see the sights of the world.
Trading is an art, and like any art needs patronage.
As the realm grows, so too does the desires and demands of its people.
Different people craft and covet differently.
An area outside the castle walls has been set aside where trading caravans can rest and resupply.
Pay tribute to the faith of the people.
Faith is the foundation of trust, which is the pathway to victory.
The first step towards restoring the light is banishing the darkness of ignorance.
To banish ignorance, one must first preserve knowledge.
Knowledge preserved is futile unless imparted on others.
The act of imparting knowledge is by itself important knowledge.
Mathematics is the language of reality.
The darkness of the past is showing weakness. Begin the process of enlightenment on this land.
With this land under control, begin the foundations of an administration on this land.
With foundations established, work on administering the land by starting with the villages.
To rule and protect, one needs taxes. Establish a system that allows you to better rule your subjects.
To actually rule the people, a local guiding hand to represent the liege is necessary.
For the darkness of the chaotic past to be expelled, the light of the law must be upheld.
For law to be upheld with force, a force to the uphold the law must exist.
The rule and point of law is to be just and fair in its rulings.
Justice, while clear-sighted, is short sighted. A scale can only balance so much weight before more is needed.
The man who knows of freedom will fight for that freedom, with steel and blood for gold and silver.
Man is a political animal, and value each other's support to carry on.
As political animals, men cherish leadership, and prefer it to come from their own.
The right to self determination demands determination. Effective freedoms granted effect freed men to better the realm.
To judge and to rule are necessary to ensure the light freedom does not become the darkness of chaos.
Service to the realm is service done to mankind. For service to be effected, a clear path must be drawn.
A man can only do as much as his world permits.
Recruit and establish a militia garrison to both protect your castles and fight with your host.
Form contracts with mercenary bands to join your host as both levied men and skilled retainers.
Recruit both veteran and unproven men from the conquered and the wandering foreigners in the realm.
Lay the foundations of defending your realm and protect your people.
Begin the foundations of walls that will rise high and defend your people.
Erect a wall worthy of songs and epics.
Improve the strength of your walls to make it harder for the invaders to breach them.
Invest in a strong keep within your castle to house defenders.
Defend the realm further by creating bastions of defence.
Expand your castle-stronghold with stronger walls and towers.
Build a mighty citadel that will tower all over the land and preserve the light.
A citadel sung even in far off lands, indomitable by many men.
Behold! A citadel of legends, known to all of man until the end of time, that not even the heroes of old could breach.
Expand your defences with more men to guard both the lands and the castle.
Develop new policies that will make the defence of the realm stronger than ever.
Establish defensive systems to further encompass the realm.
Establish a system of nobility, giving them fiefs that they will hold in exchange for men.
Empower the warrior class as well and allow them to own land in exchange for military service.
Establish a priviledged force that will serve as your personal retainers in times of war and peace.
Organize settlements of land in exchange for men.
Allow soldiers to establish settlements to contribute to the defence of the realm.
Create an assembly system that would allow levied soldiers to be gathered more effectively.
Impress men without trade or labor into service for your increasingly organized host.
Develop the beginnings a professional military.
Form closer ties with the local merchants, allowing better trade benefits
Establish a merchant guild, allowing greater control over trade.
Build warehouses that allow goods to be stocked, which allow for control over the market
Allow merchants to establish trading enclaves to enhance in your cities, from which the realm benefits benefit
Invest in an emporium for the foreign merchants, allowing them to sell wares from all over
The city's roads are made mainly of compacted earth.
The city's major roads are reinforced with sturdy wooden poles half-buried in the surface.
The city's principal roads are paved with flagstones, and kept level by teams of specialised masons.
The city's roads are lit every night by street lights, maintained by teams of lamplighters supported by minor magics.

The city authorities maintain the roads to the highest standards, and sponsor private businesses to operate large wagons drawn by draft horses, oxen, or other beasts, to transport the citizens around the metropolis.
The city has set aside an area for magical flying spelljammer ships to dock. Specially trained wizards direct the ships as they arrive and depart.
Powerful magic has twisted the very fabric of space and time. A hidden doorway in the city periodically opens onto other worlds and planes, allowing people and secrets to pass through.
Adventurers have defined Faerûn's world for many centuries. This represents adventurers resting in your holdings, preparing for the dangerous missions they will go on.
Sometimes, the best deals are done directly in foreign lands. Establishing trade colonies also allows your merchants direct access to their markets.
The act of exchange requires a path of exchange.
Look towards the horizon, and somewhere out there are people interested in your wares.
Establish ports that allow the flow of trade to and from your cities.
An institution devoted to the preservation and dissemination of knowledge
Empower your merchants to allow them to control the trade of the region.
Soldiers drafted from and trained in urban combat.
Hire local mercenaries to join your personal retinues.
Hire guards to protect your tradeposts.
Professional Heavy Cavalry and Heavy Infantry
Professional Heavy Cavalry and Heavy Infantry
Professional Heavy Cavalry and Heavy Infantry
Professional Heavy Cavalry and Heavy Infantry
Professional Heavy Cavalry and Heavy Infantry
Professional Heavy Cavalry and Heavy Infantry
Professional Heavy Cavalry and Heavy Infantry
Professional Heavy Cavalry and Heavy Infantry
Professional Heavy Cavalry and Heavy Infantry
The path of a holyman is a journey littered with temptations and false miracles. There are no miracles in the high road towards a clerical code. It is a process of discovery and realization.
Establish your family's presence around its domains.
The path of a warrior is a gauntlet rife with pitfalls and false shortcuts. There are no shortcuts in the arduous road towards the code of chivalry. It is a process of refinement and perfection.

The path of a tradesman is a voyage filled with hidden dangers and false fortune. There is no reliance on fortune in the tedious path towards a code of commerce. It is a process of practice and improvement.
The Republic is a rule by the people for the people. The Merchant Republic is a rule by the best of the people for the best of the people.
Professional Horse Archers and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Horse Archers and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Horse Archers and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Horse Archers and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Horse Archers and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Horse Archers and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Horse Archers and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Horse Archers and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Horse Archers and Heavy Cavalry
Build training grounds that would allow you to train men to guard the city in greater speed and numbers.
Establish a city guard that would serve to protect the city and fight in your wars.
Techniques in training men to defend a city are different than techniques learned from open combat.
Develop facilities that would allow you to create and service more ships.
Establish connections with shipwrights to give access to more vessels.
Establish connections to allow your merchants an advantage over local competition.
Create arrangements that give your merchant's vessels preference in the local ports.
Build a palace that will serve as the seat of your dynastic power.
With your supremacy as the legendary dynasty of Merchant Princes established, build a fortress worthy of your dynasty's power, and project it as well.
Behold! Undisputed in both authority and power, this grand citadel is a monument to the dynasty of Merchant Princes and the power they wield.

Towering high above the land, this grand palace makes the large city at its base seem like a tiny village. Curtain walls bristle with trebuchets and spikes, and even the mightiest armies of the world tremble with one look at it. It is truly a wonder of this world.

Enforce the will of your dynasty upon the local guilds! Beware! This arduous path that could last longer than a decade will tax your resources to its limits and find you in a bitter struggle to enforce supremacy.
You have successfully established your hegemony over the guilds, and your dynasty is now duly recognized as the overlord of the local mercantile world.
Your dynastic legacy has transcended history, and the might of your realm and authority makes even emperors envious.
Form contracts with mercenaries for them to serve you as retainers.
Recruit sellswords willing to be levied to fight for you.
Centralize the administration of your dynasty's domains and make it easier to call up men to your cause.
Recruit men to your service and to guard your dynasty and enforce its will.
Set up a network of couriers that would allow your dynastic domain to function more effectively and call up more men as well.
Begin the process of hiring people to manage the trivial affairs of your dynastic domains.
Consolidate your disparate holdings, and make them easier to manage.
Build connections with the right people of the right places to estalish your dynasty's power.
Build a tradition for your family that will last for ages.
This province contains monsters, fighting to be the first to kill adventurers who wander into their realm.
Professional Light Cavalry and Light Infantry
Professional Light Cavalry and Light Infantry
Professional Light Cavalry and Light Infantry
Professional Light Cavalry and Light Infantry
Professional Light Cavalry and Light Infantry
Professional Light Cavalry and Light Infantry
Professional Light Cavalry and Light Infantry
Professional Light Cavalry and Light Infantry
Professional Light Cavalry and Light Infantry
Professional Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry
Professional Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry
The world of Toril, is fraught with dangers, both human and monstrous. You, our great leader, have not only created a fortress mightier than any, but a bastion against the dangers of the world.
This tower resembles a tree with four "limbs". It radiates an aura of magic that many residents find very uncomfortable.
A wall to protect your people.
Extra troops to protect your people.

The worship of Myrkul, is often frought with mystery and necrotic tombs. Often times, these Mausoleums house the furtive priests of the Bone Lord, conducting black rituals of undeath to haunt their decrepit crypts.

The worship of Kelemvor, is the acceptance of deaths role. A far cry from the Myrkulytes, Kelemvor teaches that death need not be feared, rushed, or delayed, simply accepted. A modest philosphy, temples to the Lord of Death often bring their own prosperity.

Jergal was the first lord of the dead, or more accurately, "Lord of the End of Everything". Once God of Death, Strife, and Murder, he is now a shadow of his former glory. To Jergal, all life is temporary, an endless sea of chaos compared to the stability of deaths embrace.

The Archmage of Necromancy, Velsharoon was once a mortal, but through foul rituals and arcane means, ascended to Divine status. Patron of Liches, Necromancers, and madmen alike, their creed espouses knowledge as power, and power above all. To worship such a deity is surely frought with peril.

The Prince of Undeath, once a Demon prince of the endless abyss, Orcus status as a divine is oft questioned, though his power is not. Seen as a shortcut to immortality by madmen, many would be vampires and liches follow the horned demon, regardless of the price. As such, only death and misery will follow.

Vampires, are by far the superior warrior. With the strength of an orc, the grace of an elf, and all the bestial hunger of a ghoul, few can truly match them in the field of battle. As such, a fine retinue of vampiric knights are always welcomed, though heavy is their price.

Banshess, wights, spectres, and even shadows. Tormented souls filled with malicious intent and murderous desire for all things living. Often bound to the very brick and mortar of the castle, such spectral defenders oft obey the wishes of their Necromantic master.

Cities are naturally more populous, and often have little land to properly bury their many dead. As such, many cities construct mass grave complexes to store the sheer number of bodies. Of course, if the city was ever besieged, a ruler of lesser piety could easily put the restless spirits to work...

Vampiric Lords are terrible tyrants ill-concerned over the fate of the peasantry. A decadent class of nobility, the streets of a vampiric city are often empty at night. Jails are seen as mere dining venues, and the populace is bled dry to feed the never ending appetite of pale monsters.

The manor of many elite and noble lords is fraught with tales most grisly. Fiendish murders, twisted schemes, and black rituals deep within the mansion, are oft the tales of jealous peasants. Yet once in a while, the tales are close to reality. Foul necromancy has tainted this home, and only the malevolent will of the residing lord keeps it under check.
A small burial ground, once used by the local population to bury their dead, now used by undead masters to properly stash corpses before reanimation.
A large burial ground, complete with crypts, mausoleums and other buildings designed for space-efficient burials, now used by undead masters to properly stash corpses before reanimation.
A vast burial ground, complete with crypts, mausoleums and sprawling underground complexes, now used by undead masters to properly stash large amounts corpses before reanimation.

[Root.DruidLoc]s are places of great mystic power, tapping deep into the laylines of the earth. From young shepherds to Archdruids, as long as but a single one lives, the circle will as well. By constructing this building, great magic can be worked.

In this hidden lair, deep in the wilds of the world, is a small cache of books, parchments and minor food stock. A meager waystation for traveling druids and rangers, it is often where the Circle rests before their clandestine meetings.

Druidic circles are not a fixed location, but rather a collective group. As time moves on, more successful groups eventually acquire membership of fae and sylvan creatures. With such power, the circle is better able to influence the region.

What was once a secluded den of druids, has grown into a whole village. Whether living in great tree homes, or in fungal groves, these druids have become great guardians of the wilds, often hosting smaller fae and injured animals.

With the growth of power, the circle has decided to settle in one location. Often atop great sites of natural power, the druids begin erecting a great Menhir circle, marking the outlines of their territory. Often large stones, they are marked with magical runes.

As the Menhirs rise, an altar dedicated to one of the many deities of nature is built. Whether to peaceful Mielikii or wise Titania, the altar is the pact, a symbol of their loyalty and dedication to the forces of nature. As a result, the Circle is heavily guarded.

A great complex of standing stones constructed in a pattern magical, surrounds a sacred alter. On full moons, a host of Druids, led by the Archdruid, discuss matters temporal and spiritual. From lonesome trees to the heart of the wild, their power is felt everywhere.

Druids are the natural guardians and healers of the wild, from deep forests, to misty caves. Often times their services are needed not only by "civilized" races, but those of the wild. Healing the sick, nursing the young, and so on. A tribal druid often has a small entourage of loyal creatures, who never "left the house" so to speak.

It doesn't take much to find a den, though it's another to come out of it alive. Druids are the great peacekeepers between the wild and the tribe. Often teaching tribe members the signs of an occupied den, what creature lives there, and how best to avoid it. Often times, Druidic symbols are merely the warnings of "dangerous bear".

Certain lairs are host to more magnificent or powerful creatures. From mighty bears, to noble lions, the Druid often pays special visits, as an emissary of the tribe. In times of great peril, such as war against mutual enemies, these noble beasts will lend their assistance.

Druids are not just friends to animals, often they go to great lengths to forge ties to the fewild, whether it be a sylvan tribe or a disapora of korreds. Still, the Feywild is often a perilous place for mere mortals. A druid who intentionally tangles their tribe with it's politics risks much.

As an Archdruid of this [Root.DruidLoc], the line in the sand has been drawn. No longer a mere shaman or witch doctor, this servant of nature has thrown themselves with forces beyond mortal comprehension. Mystical beasts and fey creatures easily answer the call to war.

As the Archdruid consolidates their power, the tribe is barely recognizable from what it once was. Sylvan couplings are common, fey beasts stalk the land, and the Archdruid has physically changed. The question becomes, does the Archdruid serve for noble intent, or the whims of Fey Lords?

A great host of Druids and Rangers have pledged themselves to the Archdruid, a true Sylvan lord. As master of the [Root.DruidLoc], legendary beast serve as their generals, and even Eladrin courtiers try to curry favor. What mystical thoughts, go within their mind? What mysteries still elude them, and what by the Gods may stir this monster to wrath?

Even the weakest Druid knows much of herbs and poultices. Though many worry over the nature of war and balance, this humble Shaman simply contends themselves working the hospitals garden, producing a few goodberries. Coupled with their respectable knowledge, they can do much good for the province.

After much time and gold, the Shaman has been able to properly stock themselves with rare herbs and tools. Now a proper herbalist, with even a few assistants, they can now serve the hospital better than ever, with magical might and a healers touch.

No man or woman, however mighty, can feed the world alone. By spending much time in research, this Druid has blessed the province with the most mystical of all creations. A goodberry grove, a large patch of land capable of naturally producing such holy fruit. Famed to heal most injuries, as well as nourish the weary.

A legendary feat of both magical and druidic might, a great Archdruid has brought life to the desert. Waters flow shimmering sweet under the suns stare, while some pilgrims claim it heals body and soul. Regardless of the claims, this great Oasis is not only a pilgrimage site, but a source of great wealth.

Any city, from fair Neverwinter, to sultry Calimport, has a Thieves guild. The difference between those cities and yours, is the fact you actively engage with it. Here cutthroats and thugs can be hired for cheap, while criminal masterminds orchestrate their various rackets.

The larger, and older the city is, the more extensive their sewer system is. From a single manhole, one could theoretically find a path straight to the rulers palace. This is of course heavily utilized by the guild, often staching secret hideouts and lookouts throughout.

Despite being the ruler of this fair city, there are certain products of yours outlawed in foreign cities. Whether slaves, fine hashish, or monsters, the demand still exists in those lands, and you're just the rogue to provide it. Establishing connections between our guilds, we can easily smuggle in the goods.

There are many different businesses and trades your guild dabbles in. From simple rackets, smuggling, murder, and more, the need to properly organize has emerged. Now dividing the task between your captains, the guild has different branches entirely centered on certain crimes. Just be aware they are quite ambitious...

As open lord of the city, your authority has enough challengers from scheming nobles and undisciplined troops. But the underworld that touches every city is a ferocious beast few rulers have ever slain. Until you of course. From a veritable army of thugs and cutthroats, you've monopolized all crime underneath the streets.

Foolish rulers often leave their skullduggery with a simple courtier. You on the other hand manage it all under secret codesigns, symbols and the odd thieves cant. The city is a nest of vipers, each one eager to turn on the other, while you sit at the top perceiving all. A maid leaving early, a soldier blinking twice, all a message only you know.

If you thought the streets of the poor district were dangerous, you've seen nothing yet. The underdark is the final frontier of crime and anarchy. As one famed Drow said, "the surfacefolk always look in all directions except below". With secret outposts and guarded enclaves, traders as foreign as Deep gnomes and lethal as mind-flayers tend to visit.

As the master of your own criminal organization, it makes sense to have your own private enforcers. Quick, fast, and a cut above the rest. These Blackguards aren't cheap, but they can easily work subtler missions than the odd thug.

Dark tunnels and secret paths always have eyes watching. In the comfort of your office, trained Assassins are but a moments call away from storming the room. Such measures are necessary when dealing with fellow Patricians, who are anything but safe to deal with.

In worst-case scenarios, it's often best to squirrel away the family through the tunnels into a more secure position. Of course, in peaceful times, this bunker is the heart of your criminal activities, brimming with Assassins, Blackguards, and the odd monster. It's never easy being on top.

The merchant guards your tradepost hires, carry a few qualities the local lord may not desire. Under the cover of night, these riders stalk the roadways, slaying any lone merchant or traveler. The best part, is that these curs safely abscond with the loot behind the tradeposts walls by day.

Your tradepost has begun to form a reputation of murder and evil. As a result, you've ordered the construction of a secret hideout, far yet near enough for your robbers to continue their nightly prowl. Hopefully the local lord buys into the rumor of Robber Knights...

What began as a small hideaway has grown tremendously into a little keep. There, your Robber Knights have elected amongst themselves a Baron, a Blackguard warrior of some infamy. The local lord surely is aware of the growing threat, though the evidence does not lead to you...

Truly, the splendor of this palace would be the envy of a Shoon qysar. Its great halls shine with gold and marble, and hundreds of servants scurry through them daily in service of their masters. It is nothing less than a monument to the greatness of this dynasty.
column3: Ce somptueux palais susciterait sans aucun doute la convoitise d'un empereur romain. L'or et le marbre de ses grandes salles étincellent et les serviteurs qui s'y affairent pour servir leurs maîtres se comptent par centaines. Ce n'est rien de moins qu'un monument en l'honneur de la grandeur de cette famille.
column4: Die Herrlichkeit dieses Palastes würde wahrlich den römischen Kaiser vor Neid zerfressen. Seine großen Hallen glänzen von Gold und Marmor und hunderte von Bediensteten eilen, im Dienste ihrer Herren, durch sie hindurch. Es ist nicht weniger als ein Monument für die Bedeutsamkeit dieser Dynastie.
column6: En realidad, el esplendor de este palacio sería la envidia de un emperador de Roma. Sus grandes salones inundados por el brillo del oro y el mármol, con cientos de sirvientes atravesándolos rápidamente para dar servicio a sus señores. Es un monumento a la grandeza de su dinastía.

column2: This gallery occupies a large chamber in one of the palace wings, and it contains all works of art accumulated by members of this dynasty over the years - from contemporary tapestries to ancient marble sculptures from Jhaamdath and Coramshan.
column3: Cette galerie occupe une grande salle centrale de l'une des ailes du palais. Elle contient les oeuvres d'art accumulées par les membres de la famille au fil du temps, des tapisseries contemporaines aux antiques sculptures de marbre grecques et romaines.
column4: Diese Galerie belegt eine große Kammer in einem der Palastflügel und beinhaltet alle Kunstwerke, die von Mitgliedern dieser Dynastie über Jahre angesammelt wurden - von zeitgenössischen Gobelins bis hin zu antiken Marmorskulpturen aus Griechenland und Rom.
column6: Esta galería ocupa una gran cámara en una de las alas de palacio, y contiene todas las obras de arte acumuladas por los miembros de la dinastía a lo largo de los años - desde tapices contemporáneos hasta antiguas esculturas de mármol de Grecia y Roma.

column2: This room inside the palace is a cartographer's dream, and contains priceless maps of all sorts. Some are claimed to date back to the ancient Jhaamdathans, and others, whose accuracy cannot be gauged with any certainty, depict strange lands far to the east.
column3: Cette salle à l'intérieur du palais est le rêve de tout cartographe : elle contient de précieuses cartes maritimes en tous genres. Certaines dateraient de l'époque de la Grèce antique. D'autres, dont la précision ne peut être évaluée avec certitude, dépeignent d'étranges contrées du lointain Orient.
column4: Dieser Raum im Innern des Palastes ist der Traum eines jeden Kartographen und enthält unbezahlbare Karten aller Art. Manche sollen bis zu den alten Griechen zurückgehen, und andere, deren Genauigkeit nicht genau beurteilt werden kann, stellen fremde Länder aus dem fernen Osten dar.
column6: Esta sala dentro del palacio es el sueño de un cartógrafo, contiene todo tipo de mapas. Algunos se supone que provienen de los antiguos griegos, y otros, cuya verosimilitud no puede medirse de ningún modo, describen extrañas tierras del lejano oriente.
